alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 10:17PM MST until January 19 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Spokane Valley, Airway Heights, Pinehurst, Kellogg, St. Maries, Rockford, Davenport, Coeur d`Alene, Downtown Spokane, Dobson Pass, Fernwood, Wallace, Cheney, Post Falls, Worley, Hayden, Osburn, Lookout Pass, Mullan, Fourth Of July Pass, and Fairfield. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as snow potentially mixing with sleet and freezing rain by late Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area
